description: Consolidated economic rules for game balancing. All base rates, skill coefficients, and scaling factors in one place.

research.description: Each subsequent tier's skill benefit is multiplied by this factor. At tier 9 (index 8), benefit is 0.857^8 ≈ 0.30 (30%) of tier 1's benefit. This creates diminishing returns for deep research in a single tree.

probe.base_compute_description: Each probe has 100 PFLOPs of onboard compute, upgradeable through intelligence research

probe_transfer.description: Starting probe delta-v capacity. Limits which orbits probes can self-transfer to.

alpha_factors.description: DEPRECATED: No longer used. Previously controlled geometric mean exponent. Now using weighted sum: factor = 1 + Σ(weight_i * (skill_i - 1))

skill_coefficients.description: Coefficients for combining skills into upgrade factors. Uses weighted sum formula: factor = 1 + Σ(weight_i * (skill_i - 1)). Weights are relative - higher weight means that skill contributes more to the final factor.

compute.description: Skills affecting orbital data center compute capacity

probe_compute.description: Skills affecting per-probe onboard compute capacity (base 100 PFLOPs)

dyson_compute.description: Skills affecting Dyson sphere compute capacity

dyson_energy.description: Skills affecting Dyson sphere energy output

salvage_efficiency.description: Metal recovery percentage from scrapping structures

probe_delta_v_capacity.description: Probe delta-v capacity for orbital transfers

mass_driver_efficiency.description: Mass driver energy efficiency (% of input energy converted to kinetic)

methalox_production.description: Skills affecting methalox refinery output rate

methalox_energy_cost.description: Skills reducing methalox refinery power consumption

crowding.description: Zone crowding penalty parameters. At 1% probe mass ratio: no penalty. At 90%: 2% efficiency.

probe_count_scaling.description: Diminishing returns for probe count within each zone. Each doubling of probe count reduces efficiency. Formula: efficiency = (1 - penalty_per_doubling)^log2(probe_count). Compute upgrades reduce the penalty from base to min.

global_replication_scaling.description: Global penalty to probe replication rate based on total probe count. After threshold, each order of magnitude (10x) growth halves replication rate. Formula: efficiency = halving_factor^max(0, log10(totalProbes) - log10(threshold)). At 1e13: 50% rate, at 1e14: 25% rate, etc.

particle_visualization.description: Unified Pareto distribution for all particle visualizations (mining, recycling, replication, mass transfers). Uses power-law distribution: many small particles, few large ones. Applied consistently across metal, slag, methalox, and probes.

mass_distribution.description: Pareto distribution with α = 1.15 gives heavy tail. Range spans 16 orders of magnitude from 1 megakilogram (1000 tonnes) to 10 zettakilograms (planet-chunk scale). With truncation at max_mass, effective expected value ≈ 1e21 kg.

visual_size.description: Logarithmic scaling from mass to visual size. size = minSize * (maxSize/minSize)^(t^exponent) where t = (log₁₀(mass) - 6) / 16. Exponent < 1 shifts distribution toward larger sizes. Default 0.4 gives good visual presence for particles.

spawn_rate.description: Particles spawned per game day, capped to prevent visual overload while maintaining proportionality to production rates.

probe_individual.description: First N probes at each zone are shown as individual dots with fixed size. Remaining probes are visualized as mass particles using the unified distribution. Transfer size is for probes in transit.

drift_animation.description: Duration in game days for particles to drift from spawn point to orbital position. driftDuration = base + distanceRatio * scaling

calibration.description: Distribution calibrated so Jupiter's full mass converts to approximately 800,000 particles. E[X] = α * minMass / (α - 1) with truncation.
